text: Debbie Wood (born May 25, 1961) is an American politician from Alabama. Wood is a Republican member of the Alabama House of Representatives from the 38th district, serving since 2018. ==Early life and career== Wood owns a real estate business. ==Political career== Wood ran for the House seat after the incumbent, Isaac Whorton, announced he was running for circuit judge. Wood defeated fellow Republican Todd Rauch by 8 votes in the state's July primary runoff. She defeated Democrat Brian McGee in the November 2018 general election. ==References== Category:Living people Category:Members of the Alabama House of Representatives Category:Alabama Republicans Category:Women state legislators in Alabama Category:1961 births
title: Debbie Wood
